data.name: LOC_ID_CLASS_DESC_10

data.name: LOC_ID_CLASS_DESC_11

data.name: LOC_ID_CLASS_DESC_15

data.name: LOC_ID_CREDITS_SCREEN_22
data.value: Thanks to all our fans for their support!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_10
data.value: Although I am the eldest child, I am not my father's favorite. I have always known he planned to leave me with nothing.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_100
data.value: ...And what if I mistook them for a monster?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_103
data.value: I must be going insane. I stumbled across a carnival inside this castle. Complete with a sad clown and everything.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_104
data.value: He's sort of an ass. But I guess you can't be picky with your friends in a place like this.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_105
data.value: I'm getting hungry again. Good thing I topped up on chicken legs. I found these in a chandelier.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_106
data.value: This castle... Sometimes I wonder if it's all just a big joke.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_109
data.value: I have bested the beast of the tower, and once again I could feel the throne room give up some of its power.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_11
data.value: But if I find the cure, everything will change.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_110
data.value: The rush I feel from this victory is intoxicating! Never have I felt so confident, so powerful, so...at home. Just a little further and I will be able to earn my reward!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_111
data.value: I'm so close! I will make my father proud!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_114
data.value: I have been standing outside the dungeon gate for longer then I care to admit.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_115
data.value: My courage has finally been sapped, for I have spied the monsters below, and they make my previous struggles laughable in comparison.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_116
data.value: I must steel myself. I must focus. There is so little light down there, I fear that I may lose myself.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_119
data.value: I thought I knew what darkness was, but here in the dungeon, the darkness has a voice.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_12
data.value: The victor will earn nothing less than the throne upon his passing!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_120
data.value: It calls at me through grates, and around corners. It taunts me.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_121
data.value: The darkness is so thick, it is almost tangible, and the beasts here have made it their home. They move swiftly through the corridors, and are more terrifying then anything I've fought before.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_122
data.value: I must be prudent and choose my battles carefully. Being confrontational now may cost me my life.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_125
data.value: I have done it! I have defeated the dungeon's master! All that remains is to enter the throne room.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_126
data.value: After this, the king will honor me for my valor and acknowledge me as rightful successor to the throne!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_13
data.value: Upon my ascension, my wife and my children shall move back into the royal quarters. Back to the royal city, where we once again will be treated with the respect we deserve!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_130
data.value: I sit here making my final preparations. All that lays between me and the lord of this castle is the golden doors.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_131
data.value: There is an nervousness in my body that I cannot quell. Is this fear, or fearcitement? All I know is that my journey is finally reaching an end.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_132
data.value: I have almost forgotten why I entered this castle in the first place, but I remember now.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_133
data.value: I have bested my siblings, I will save the king, and leave this castle a greater man then when I entered. My family will get the honor they so rightfully deserve.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_134
data.value: Now, I enter the throne room.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_137
data.value: I never knew what treasure lay in this castle. I knew only that it would cure the king.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_138
data.value: Who could have suspected it would be the fountain of youth?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_139
data.value: I expected a monster to greet me at the dias; a foe of unimaginable strength. I imagined it would take all my strength to best him.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_14
data.value: No longer will we stand for the gossip and petty slander of my cousins. The other dukes shall bow as we pass! But I am getting ahead of myself.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_140
data.value: But when I entered the castle and saw my father - the king - sitting atop the dias with goblet in hand, I knew all was lost.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_143
data.value: There are no words to express what I feel.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_15
data.value: I must keep my priorities clear: Conquer the castle. Find the cure. Collect my reward.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_150
data.value: Today marks the rest of eternity.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_151
data.value: I never knew what treasure lay in this castle. Just that it would cure the king of his illness.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_152
data.value: ... Who would have known it would have been the fountain of youth? A myth, which grants one eternal life.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_153
data.value: As I look down on the body of the king I realize that it is inevitable: children will always answer for their father's sins.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_154
data.value: I entered this castle a swordsman, a savior...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_155
data.value: But all I have left is a rogue's legacy.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_156
data.value: I can feel your anger, but know it was not I who sent your family to ruin.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_157
data.value: The moment the king set foot within this castle, the royal coffers were emptied by Charon. My family - all families - had lost all hope for a better life.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_158
data.value: And in my mind's eye, I foresaw only desperation and poverty ravage the country. There was nothing for me to go back to.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_159
data.value: To my children, and my children's children, here I sit, impassive, immortal, and await thee.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_161
data.value: What is this? Are you... mocking me?!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_162
data.value: After countless generations of your ancestors sacrificed their lives to be where you are now, the final steps to achieving their hollow justice. And you arrive and mock me?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_163
data.value: Very well, I will spare your ignorance. Let us begin!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_165
data.value: Why do you wish to fight me? How many sons and daughters have been lost in your pathetic attempts at revenge?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_166
data.value: It was the king who brought ruin to your country, not I!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_167
data.value: He lied to us. He said he was wounded, yet it was only time that threatened him!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_168
data.value: He pitted his children against one another, sacrificed everything to satisfy his own selfish desires, and in the end, left us penniless and alone.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_169
data.value: So I took the only option left to me. I rejected king and country...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_170
data.value: And chose a new family instead!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_172
data.value: You think you have slain me?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_173
data.value: I have lived for over a thousand years, and I will live for ten thousand more!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_175
data.value: I was not the first hero to reach the fountain...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_176
data.value: But I will be the last!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_179
data.value: You have defeated me... But at what price?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_18
data.value: I have paid my dues, and entered the castle proper. That devil Charon has taken all that I own as payment.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_180
data.value: I may have slain the king, but only after he betrayed his people.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_181
data.value: Ask yourself what justice has been met?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_182
data.value: In the end we are all guilty of the same sin. Look to your forefathers - such is the cost for unquestioned loyalty.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_186
data.value: I had forgotten how it feels...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_19
data.value: He has even pilfered my private coffers! I have left my wife and children with nothing.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_20
data.value: He says it's the price for any and all who hazard the depths of the castle. He says it is fair.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_21
data.value: It is fair because of all who have entered, none have returned. But I will change that.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_22
data.value: I will be victorious! There is no greater swordsman than I, even amongst my siblings.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_25
data.value: Everything about this castle is off. I can't seem to keep track of my headings, and there is no sun or stars to guide me.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_26
data.value: I find myself backtracking constantly, and I must painstakingly map out my progress lest I go in circles.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_27
data.value: The maps I have pilfered off the corpses of other adventurers are breathtakingly inaccurate. It is almost as if they were describing a different castle altogether!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_28
data.value: Perhaps this place does something to the mind...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_29
data.value: Or are the stones truly shifting beneath my feet?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_3
data.value: Treason! An assassin has wounded my father, the king!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_32
data.value: I cannot exit through the front gate, but that is of little concern. I am committed to my cause and will not back out!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_33
data.value: So far none of the maps I've found coincide with my own.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_34
data.value: Yet upon comparing them as a whole, I believe I have unearthed a slight pattern. It seems the forest is always to the right; the tower above...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_35
data.value: And below? Well, hopefully I won't have to find out.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_38
data.value: I have never liked the dark. I prefer to meet my enemies on an open field in plain sight.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_39
data.value: But now I find myself braving these darkened gallows with one gauntlet outstreched, the other by my hilt. I can never tell what horror lies beyond each corner.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_4
data.value: To bring order back to the kingdom, he has sent my siblings and I on a quest to save him. Together, we will venture into the cursed woods, and enter Castle Hamson.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_40
data.value: I am the greatest swordsman in all the lands, yet even I am having trouble keeping these demons at bay.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_41
data.value: My siblings should be grateful that I rushed ahead of them. For them it was a blessing in disguise. They would not have the fortitude to survive these halls.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_44
data.value: It is still night. Past every window stares back the same melancholic moon, but I swear I have been here for at least a whole waking day.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_45
data.value: It must be the adrenaline. I have never felt so powerful, yet simultaneously challenged. It is exhilarating to charge through these rooms, cutting down enemy after enemy.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_46
data.value: In some ways the foes in this castle feel tailored to me. Training me, guiding me, watching me.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_47
data.value: This may sound crazy, but if this castle can somehow sense those within it, I fear it may hold malicious intent as well. If my assumptions are correct, the design of these halls could all be a ploy, culling me down further into a trap.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_5
data.value: This cursed castle has stood on the edge of the woods since time immemorial, but rumors say that within it dwells an item which will cure any ailment.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_51
data.value: From the number of dead adventurers I have passed in these halls, I have come to the following conclusions:

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_52
data.value: 1: Many did not take enough provisions with them. I assume many died of hunger. I myself am running low and will have to find more supplies.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_53
data.value: 2: Many are missing clothes, which explains the pant-wearing zombies.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_54
data.value: 3: No one has made it as far as I, since I haven't passed any corpses in over an hour.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_57
data.value: The door to the throne room is driving me mad! Beyond it lies the king's salvation, and my reward, but it stands silent in the middle of the castle foyer, taunting me.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_58
data.value: I've tried pushing it, kicking it, yelling "Open Sesame", but nothing works.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_59
data.value: There are icons emblazoned into the doors, and one of them looks like a beast I avoided deeper in the castle. Perhaps there is some sort of correlation?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_6
data.value: Tonight I will get a headstart over my brothers and sisters, and set forth on my quest while they lay asleep.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_62
data.value: The emblems on the castle door are a clue! I slew the giant beast that matched one of the icons, and I sensed something shift behind the throne room doors.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_63
data.value: As if in a dream, I could see an emblem on the door glowing in my mind's eye.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_64
data.value: A truly out of body experience.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_65
data.value: At least I know I'm on the right track. But I must hasten my pace, for the king could succumb to his injuries at any moment...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_66
data.value: But first I must rest. Tomorrow, I enter the Forest.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_69
data.value: This forest is unlike anything I've ever seen before. It is both serene and terrifying. I stand on lush grass, but beside me yawns open a chasm so wide and deep, it threatens to swallow me whole.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_7
data.value: To fail this quest would be an embarrassment to my name.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_70
data.value: I still have not heard a response from the rock I tossed in earlier. A single misstep, and my descent would be eternal. It is truly a horrifying thought.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_71
data.value: An eternity of darkness is more frightening than any beast I have fought thus far. If I fell, what would kill me first? The hunger, or myself?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_72
data.value: On a side note, I am now using the forest fissure as my own personal lavatory. I wonder if I am pooping into another dimension...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_75
data.value: I have found a solution to my hunger problem. The forest holds an endless bounty of delicious mushrooms.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_76
data.value: And within these mushrooms lie chicken legs! Also gold coins, and vials of sparkling water... I broke open a tree trunk earlier, and a bag of money fell out.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_77
data.value: Sometimes I feel like I have gone insane.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_78
data.value: ... Plus, what is up with the moon? It's HUGE!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_81
data.value: I slew the beast of the forest, and I have felt the throne room weaken once more.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_82
data.value: So far my assumptions have proven correct. Each wing of the castle houses its own guardian beast. Was this designed as a test of will? If so, then I cannot fail, for the further I venture, the more bold I become!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_83
data.value: Tomorrow I scour the tower. I am on a roll.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_86
data.value: I have been methodically clearing the demons in these rooms in my quest to slay the next guardian, but I am losing track of time... and other things...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_87
data.value: As I entered the tower, I felt time stand still. Or perhaps that is the vertigo talking? I was never keen on heights...or was I?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_88
data.value: I am finding it increasingly difficult to remember my past...

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_91
data.value: I remember being a famous adventurer. My martial prowress surpassed all of my brothers. That, I am sure of. While they spent their days buried in their bookish studies, I was out killing brigands and monsters.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_92
data.value: I always wondered why my father favoured them over me? Isn't it always the opposite in fairytales?

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_93
data.value: Fortune favors the bold. Not the insipid intellectual... Or something like that.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_94
data.value: Man, I would love to see my brothers try to out think my sword in their face!

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_97
data.value: What if years have passed since I first entered these walls? It is true that I am becoming more proficient in clearing monsters, but it feels like an age has passed.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_98
data.value: I have even forgotten what my own kin look like.

data.name: LOC_ID_DIARY_99
data.value: What if they think I have failed? What if one of my brothers has beaten me to the cure?

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_1
data.value: Grants you the power to jump in the air. Multiple runes stack, allowing for multiple jumps.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_10
data.value: Harder enemies, but greater rewards. Multiple runes stack making enemies even harder.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_11
data.value: Enemies scale slower, easier but lesser rewards. Multiple runes stack slowing enemy scaling more.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_2
data.value: Gain the power to dash short distances. Multiple runes stack allowing for multiple dashes.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_3
data.value: Killing enemies will drain them of their health. Multiple runes stack for increased life drain.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_4
data.value: Gain the power of flight. Multiple runes stack for longer flight duration.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_5
data.value: Steals mana from slain enemies. Multiple runes stack for increased mana drain.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_6
data.value: Slaying enemies grants both HP and MP. Multiple runes stack for increased hp/mp drain.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_7
data.value: Returns damage taken from enemies. Multiple runes stack increasing the damage return

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_8
data.value: Increase the amount of gold you get from coins. Multiple runes stack for increased gold gain.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_DESC_9
data.value: Increase your base move speed. Multiple runes stack making you even faster.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_INST_6
data.value: Kill enemies to regain health and mana.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_SHORT_10
data.value: Earn 60% total gold in the castle.

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_SHORT_3_NEW
data.value: Gain back {0} HP for every kill

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_SHORT_5_NEW
data.value: Gain back {0} MP for every kill

data.name: LOC_ID_EQUIPMENT_SHORT_8_NEW
data.value: Each gold drop is {0}% more valuable

data.name: LOC_ID_GAME_OVER_BOSS_SCREEN_3
data.value: The sun... I had forgotten how it feels...

data.name: LOC_ID_GAME_OVER_SCREEN_5
data.value: was done in by a projectile

data.name: LOC_ID_GAME_OVER_SCREEN_6
data.value: slipped and was impaled by spikes

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_1
data.value: The Forest is always to the right side of the Castle.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_10
data.value: Sky runes let you fly by pressing

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_10_NEW
data.value: Sky runes let you fly by pressing [Input:10] while in the air.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_11
data.value: Vampirism and Siphon runes are very powerful when stacked.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_12
data.value: Mastering mobility runes makes you awesome.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_13
data.value: Make sure to expand your manor. You never know what new skills can be revealed.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_14
data.value: All classes can be upgraded with unique class abilities.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_15
data.value: Unlocked class abilities can be activated with

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_15_NEW
data.value: Unlocked class abilities can be activated with [Input:13]

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_16
data.value: Upgrade your classes early to obtain powerful class abilities.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_17
data.value: If you are having trouble with a room, see if you can bypass it instead.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_18
data.value: Buying equipment is the fastest way to raise your stats.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_19
data.value: Purchasing equipment is cheaper and more flexible than raising your base stats.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_2
data.value: The Maya is always at the top of the Castle.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_20
data.value: You should have picked the other child.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_21
data.value: Runes are very powerful. Equip runes at the Enchantress, and don't forget to use them!

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_22
data.value: Learn the nuances of your spell to maximize their potential.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_23
data.value: Try to hit enemies near the apex of the axe's arc in order to hit them multiple times.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_24
data.value: Avoid picking up the conflux orbs after casting it to maximize damage.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_25
data.value: Dodge the chakrams return trip in order to maximize its damage.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_26
data.value: Better to use mana to kill enemies than to take unnecessary damage.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_27
data.value: Learning enemy 'tells' is integral to surviving the castle.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_28
data.value: Spike traps check for a pulse to tell the dead from the living.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_3
data.value: The Darkness is always at the bottom of the Castle.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_30
data.value: Fairy chests hold all the runes in the game. Runes will help you immensely.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_31
data.value: If you fail a Fairy chest room, the Architect can give you a second chance.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_32
data.value: The Architect has a hefty fee for those who use his service.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_33
data.value: Bosses drop large amounts of gold on their death.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_35
data.value: If you are having trouble, try equipping Grace runes.

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_36
data.value: In options you can enable Quick Drop to downstrike and drop with

data.name: LOC_ID_HINT_36_NEW

You're a heavy breather. Bad for stalking, good for walking!

data.name: LOC_ID_SKILL_DESC_34
data.value: You were infused with tiger blood at a young age. You have now been infused with the power to release tiger blood when stabbed. \nRunning drains less endurance.

data.name: LOC_ID_SKILL_DESC_35
data.value: Your have viking ancestry. \n\nIncrease your starting endurance.

data.name: LOC_ID_SKILL_DESC_36
data.value: You're an early waker. If leveling was like waking up.\n Gain bonus HP and MP every time you level.

data.name: LOC_ID_SKILL_DESC_37

LOCK IT DOWN!

data.name: LOC_ID_SKILL_UNLOCK_5
data.value: Trained more in the art of making money then killing enemies. Miners are best used for scouring the castle for treasure chests, and avoiding confrontation.

data.name: LOC_ID_SKILL_UNLOCK_6

data.name: LOC_ID_SKILL_UNLOCK_7

data.name: LOC_ID_SKILL_UNLOCK_8

data.value: I used to be a very powerful Enchantress. But one day, the monsters of this castle invaded my dreams and stole my knowledge.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_157
data.value: Don't **** Your Pants.\nDevelopment Time: 2 days.\nRelease Date: February 16, 2009

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_16
data.value: This lever here? With a simple pull, I can prevent the castle from changing.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_160
data.value: This was the first game we ever made, and back then we used to be called Decade Studios. In it you must stop a man from pooping himself using only text input.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_161
data.value: It was originally designed on a bus, and we decided to make it on the weekend. It did pretty well.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_162
data.value: The game has a swear word in it, and we were thinking about changing the title to be more friendly. But then our balls grew back and we stuck to our guns.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_163
data.value: A big part of the game revolved around making a text adventure that allowed people to input whatever they wanted. To solve this we had to pre-empt what we thought people would type.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_164
data.value: We did this in 2 ways. First, we reduced the amount of options a player had (A man and a door), and secondly, we built an achievement system which was used to give the player direction.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_165
data.value: The game revolved around the achievement system so heavily that it was placed into the game over screen progression. That was a small but very vital change.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_167
data.value: Band of Bears\nDevelopment Time: 4 months.\nRelease Date: August 6, 2009

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_17
data.value: This way you can go through exactly what your ancestors went through. Impreeeessed? You should be.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_170
data.value: This was our second game we ever attempted, and it was for the 2009 DreamBuildPlay contest. We found out about it pretty late, so we had to play catch up with everyone else.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_171
data.value: Fresh off the success of DSYP we decided to go big... stupidly big. And thus, Cellar Door Games was formed.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_172
data.value: On top of starting a project well beyond our resources and expertise, we also juggled full-time jobs to get this game running. It was pretty sucky.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_173
data.value: The game featured the B.E.A.R.S system (Bare Effort Adaptable Room System), which would change rooms depending on the number of players playing.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_174
data.value: The BEARS system didn't just tweak numbers, it tweaked puzzles as well. We ended up in the Top 20 which was good but not high enough to win anything.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_175
data.value: Eventually reality (and common sense) came back to us and we realized we had to scrap the project, or in the very least put it on indefinite hiatus.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_176
data.value: The demo boss was pretty frickin cool.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_178
data.value: Tribal Tallies\nDevelopment Time: 3 months.\nRelease Date: November 23rd, 2009

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_18
data.value: How did I build this fantastic connnnnnnntraption? With sccccccience of course! And magic.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_181
data.value: Tribal Tallies was the first project we had worked on months after the horrible experience with Band of Bears.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_182
data.value: It was a bit of a test project, to dabble our feet in water of iOS gaming since we had never tried making something on mobile platforms before.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_183
data.value: The game was simple in concept, as you tapped numbers in sequence as fast as you could.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_184
data.value: To spice things up we implemented several modes, like tap backwards, hidden numbers, and tap matching.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_185
data.value: We thought the scope was reasonable, but the game ended up taking much more time to make than expected. It didn't help it was all coded on a hackintosh.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_186
data.value: It was a pretty plain game. We could have done better, but we were all playing it safe after Band of Bears.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_191
data.value: Our fourth project. After Tribal Tallies we took a few months off from making games and just focused on our full-time jobs. We got angsty again, so we decided to make a puzzle game.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_192
data.value: At this point most of the original founders of Cellar Door Games left to pursue other opportunities, and the unwanted remnants are what compose the company today.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_193
data.value: The game used a queuing combo mechanism to force players to think about how the tiles would fall in order to build massive combos.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_194
data.value: We made it free but nobody picked it up either. After the failures of Band of Bears, Tribal Tallies, and Q, we prepped ourselves to pack it in and close the company.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_196
data.value: My First Quantum Translocator\nDevelopment Time: 1 month.\nRelease Date: October 13th, 2010

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_199
data.value: My First Quantum Translocator came about when our company was at its lowest point. After 3 failed games we had already mentally checked out, and decided to make this tiny flash game for kicks.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_20
data.value: But my skills aren't freeeeee. If I lock this castle, I will take 40% of allll the gold you earn!

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_200
data.value: Absolutely no expectations were made during development, and it was more of something we did for fun than anything else.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_201
data.value: Needless to say, response to the game was huge and it is the sole reason that Cellar Door Games exists today. The moment we released MFQT we knew there was no going back.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_202
data.value: Interestingly enough, most people believe the game was inspired by Portal, but their similarities were completely coincidental.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_203
data.value: The game actually spawned from a character we had dreamt up for the game, League of Legends.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_204
data.value: In truth the commonalities between Portal and MFQT only started to come up once we added final art and story to the game.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_205
data.value: Either way, we were pretty proud of the game. It played well and it had a nice ending.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_207
data.value: I Have 1 Day\nDevelopment Time: 1.5 months.\nRelease Date: April 15th, 2011

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_210
data.value: If you ever asked us, of all the game we made which one would be our favourite, there would be a unanimous agreement with I Have 1 Day.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_211
data.value: As children we were raised on the adventure game classics like Kings Quest and Monkey Island, so this was really our homage to some of the best experiences we ever had in gaming.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_212
data.value: The game revolves around a meta-time puzzle where the player had only 24 hours to beat the game.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_213
data.value: Every puzzle had multiple solutions with time repercussions, which forced players to think of the best way to go about solving things.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_214
data.value: One interesting fact. The second ending was added at virtually the last minute, and without it the entire game would have sucked.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_219
data.value: Villainous was one of the more risky endeavours we undertook.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_22
data.value: Do you want to lock the castle and get only 60% gold?

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_220
data.value: The initial concept was a reverse tower defense, which sounded like it could be a good idea, but we had a hard time converting the 'could' to 'would'.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_221
data.value: Most people who have played the game thinks the process was an obvious one, but lots of stress and arguments were involved in this project.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_222
data.value: The entire idea was scrapped 3 or 4 times before we settled on its final version.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_223
data.value: It is ironic then, that to-date Villainous is far and away one of our most successful titles. It was also the most painful.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_225
data.value: Bullet Audyssey\nDevelopment Time: 3.5 months.\nRelease Date: November 29th, 2011

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_228
data.value: Bullet Audyssey was our very last game prior to working on Rogue Legacy.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_229
data.value: Being a bullet hell that was based on rhythm and beat charts, Bullet Audyssey was the most technically challenging game we had ever worked on (yes, even moreso than Rogue Legacy).

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_230
data.value: Just to create a stage required 3 editors running in unison.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_231
data.value: Development for this game was also a little non-traditional, as a lot of pre-planning was required to make sure everything clicked.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_232
data.value: Being heavy advocates against documentation, this didn't settle well with us, so we had to talk out the whole game, for like, half a day.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_233
data.value: The game had the player absorbing enemy bullets in order to fire them back and absorption happened on a beat which matched the song being played.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_234
data.value: Initial playtests were disastrous, as the game was too hard and people became incredibly frustrated in the very first minute.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_235
data.value: By playtests, we mean 1 dude who doesn't even like Bullet Hells. But that's larger then our usual test pool.

data.name: LOC_ID_TEXT_236
data.value: The game didn't perform very well when it released. That gave us the confidence to make Rogue Legacy!

data.name: LOC_ID_PORTRAIT_TEXT_NEW_1
data.value: Full Metal Furies\nDevelopment Time: 4 years.\nRelease Date: January 17, 2018

data.name: LOC_ID_PORTRAIT_TEXT_NEW_2
data.value: Full Metal Furies is from the future! It’s our follow-up game after Rogue Legacy, and the tenth game we’ve ever made.

data.name: LOC_ID_PORTRAIT_TEXT_NEW_3
data.value: After RL, we promised ourselves we would never make a game without planning it out ever again. We lied. Curse you past-selves!

data.name: LOC_ID_PORTRAIT_TEXT_NEW_4
data.value: The game ended up becoming one of our most ambitious projects ever, and was a mishmash of a brawler/multiplayer/meta-puzzle/coming-of-age disco ideas that turned the traditional view a brawler on its head the longer you played.

data.name: LOC_ID_PORTRAIT_TEXT_NEW_5
data.value: At 4 years, FMF is the longest time we’ve ever spent on development, and sadly also has some of lowest returns we've seen for our games. (Excluding those iOS games which generated negative bucks, curse you past-selves!)

data.name: LOC_ID_PORTRAIT_TEXT_NEW_6
data.value: But we’re still immensely proud of what we created, and even more proud of the FRIENDS WE MADE ALONG THE WAY. AWWWWWWW!!!
